column3: ACK - is both necessary and correct\n
Looks like Travis timed out on a couple of jobs.\n
Somehow even if travis successfully installs `libzmq3` and `python-zmq`, the rpc test can't connect over zmq with bitcoind.\nStill try to figure out why...\n
Does this work locally? It's not clear to me what needs to be native and what needs to be per-arch.\n

@theuni 
The zmq_test.py (RPC test) works prefect locally. Tested on OSX/Debian and Ubuntu.
The `zmq_test.py` changes within this PR are for debugging purposes. 
I can only encounter the problem in Travis builds.
It looks like that zmq tcp:// connection does not work in travis. Even after installing python-zmq. Also my solution (`sudo rm -f /etc/apt/sources.list.d/travis_ci_zeromq3-source.list
@theuni: Any idea how we could fix this? Having CI tests for the ZMQ would be important IMO otherwise the risks are high that things break without noticing.\n
@jonasschnelli I need to spend a bit of time learning about the intricacies of zmq/python here. But I'll try to track down the issue.\n

@jonasschnelli This fixes: https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin/commit/05a7243678e97b3944c5ceb23c4b05c57fb9c42f . Problem was the old libzmq that the pyzmq was using. Installing the newer pyzmq from a ppa pulls in newer versions of both.\n

Added @theuni commit.
Travis is happy now.
This would add CI coverage of the ZMQ feature.
